verses.verse: These <S%H428><s%> are also <S%H1571><s%> proverbs <S%H4912><s%> of Solomon, <S%H8010><s%> which <S%H834><s%> the men <S%H376><s%> of Hezekiah <S%H2396><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> copied out. <S%H6275><s%>

It is the glory <S%H3519><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> to conceal <S%H5641><s%> a thing: <S%H1697><s%> but the honor <S%H3519><s%> of kings <S%H4428><s%> is to search out <S%H2713><s%> a matter. <S%H1697><s%>
The heaven <S%H8064><s%> for height, <S%H7312><s%> and the earth <S%H776><s%> for depth, <S%H6011><s%> and the heart <S%H3820><s%> of kings <S%H4428><s%> is unsearchable. <S%H369><s%> <S%H2714><s%>
Take away <S%H1898><s%> the dross <S%H5509><s%> from the silver, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3701><s%> and there shall come forth <S%H3318><s%> a vessel <S%H3627><s%> for the refiner. <S%H6884><s%>
Take away <S%H1898><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> from before <S%H6440><s%> the king, <S%H4428><s%> and his throne <S%H3678><s%> shall be established <S%H3559><s%> in righteousness. <S%H6664><s%>

Put not forth thyself <S%H408><s%> <S%H1921><s%> in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the king, <S%H4428><s%> and stand <S%H5975><s%> not <S%H408><s%> in the place <S%H4725><s%> of great <S%H1419><s%> men:

For <S%H3588><s%> better <S%H2896><s%> it is that it be said <S%H559><s%> unto thee, Come up <S%H5927><s%> hither; <S%H2008><s%> than that thou shouldest be put lower <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8213><s%> in the presence <S%H6440><s%> of the prince <S%H5081><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> thine eyes <S%H5869><s%> have seen. <S%H7200><s%>

Go not forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H408><s%> hastily <S%H4118><s%> to strive, <S%H7378><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> thou know not what <S%H4100><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> in the end <S%H319><s%> thereof, when thy neighbor <S%H7453><s%> hath put thee to shame. <S%H3637><s%> <S%H853><s%>
Debate <S%H7378><s%> thy cause <S%H7379><s%> with <S%H854><s%> thy neighbor <S%H7453><s%> himself; and discover <S%H1540><s%> not <S%H408><s%> a secret <S%H5475><s%> to another: <S%H312><s%>
Lest <S%H6435><s%> he that heareth <S%H8085><s%> it put thee to shame, <S%H2616><s%> and thine infamy <S%H1681><s%> turn not away. <S%H3808><s%> <S%H7725><s%>
A word <S%H1697><s%> fitly <S%H5921><s%> <S%H655><s%> spoken <S%H1696><s%> is like apples <S%H8598><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%> in pictures <S%H4906><s%> of silver. <S%H3701><s%>

As an earring <S%H5141><s%> of gold, <S%H2091><s%> and an ornament <S%H2481><s%> of fine gold, <S%H3800><s%> so is a wise <S%H2450><s%> reprover <S%H3198><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> an obedient <S%H8085><s%> ear. <S%H241><s%>

As the cold <S%H6793><s%> of snow <S%H7950><s%> in the time <S%H3117><s%> of harvest, <S%H7105><s%> so is a faithful <S%H539><s%> messenger <S%H6735><s%> to them that send <S%H7971><s%> him: for he refresheth <S%H7725><s%> the soul <S%H5315><s%> of his masters. <S%H113><s%>
Whoso <S%H376><s%> boasteth himself <S%H1984><s%> of a false <S%H8267><s%> gift <S%H4991><s%> is like clouds <S%H5387><s%> and wind <S%H7307><s%> without <S%H369><s%> rain. <S%H1653><s%>
By long <S%H753><s%> forbearing <S%H639><s%> is a prince <S%H7101><s%> persuaded, <S%H6601><s%> and a soft <S%H7390><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> breaketh <S%H7665><s%> the bone. <S%H1634><s%>

Hast thou found <S%H4672><s%> honey? <S%H1706><s%> eat <S%H398><s%> so much as is sufficient <S%H1767><s%> for thee, lest <S%H6435><s%> thou be filled <S%H7646><s%> therewith, and vomit <S%H6958><s%> it.

Withdraw <S%H3365><s%> thy foot <S%H7272><s%> from thy neighbor's <S%H7453><s%> house; <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1004><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> he be weary <S%H7646><s%> of thee, and so hate <S%H8130><s%> thee.

A man <S%H376><s%> that beareth <S%H6030><s%> false <S%H8267><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> against his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> is a maul, <S%H4650><s%> and a sword, <S%H2719><s%> and a sharp <S%H8150><s%> arrow. <S%H2671><s%>

Confidence <S%H4009><s%> in an unfaithful man <S%H898><s%> in time <S%H3117><s%> of trouble <S%H6869><s%> is like a broken <S%H7465><s%> tooth, <S%H8127><s%> and a foot <S%H7272><s%> out of joint. <S%H4154><s%>

As he that taketh away <S%H5710><s%> a garment <S%H899><s%> in cold <S%H7135><s%> weather, <S%H3117><s%> and as vinegar <S%H2558><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> niter, <S%H5427><s%> so is he that singeth <S%H7891><s%> songs <S%H7892><s%> to <S%H5921><s%> a heavy <S%H7451><s%> heart. <S%H3820><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> thine enemy <S%H8130><s%> be hungry, <S%H7457><s%> give him bread <S%H3899><s%> to eat; <S%H398><s%> and if <S%H518><s%> he be thirsty, <S%H6771><s%> give him water <S%H4325><s%> to drink: <S%H8248><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> thou <S%H859><s%> shalt heap <S%H2846><s%> coals of fire <S%H1513><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> his head, <S%H7218><s%> and the LORD <S%H3068><s%> shall reward <S%H7999><s%> thee.
The north <S%H6828><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> driveth away <S%H2342><s%> rain: <S%H1653><s%> so doth an angry <S%H2194><s%> countenance <S%H6440><s%> a backbiting <S%H5643><s%> tongue. <S%H3956><s%>

It is better <S%H2896><s%> to dwell <S%H3427><s%> in <S%H5921><s%> the corner <S%H6438><s%> of the housetop, <S%H1406><s%> than with a brawling woman <S%H4480><s%> <S%H802><s%> <S%H4079><s%> and in a wide <S%H2267><s%> house. <S%H1004><s%>

As cold <S%H7119><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> to <S%H5921><s%> a thirsty <S%H5889><s%> soul, <S%H5315><s%> so is good <S%H2896><s%> news <S%H8052><s%> from a far country. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H776><s%> <S%H4801><s%>

A righteous <S%H6662><s%> man falling down <S%H4131><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is as a troubled <S%H7515><s%> fountain, <S%H4599><s%> and a corrupt <S%H7843><s%> spring. <S%H4726><s%>
It is not <S%H3808><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> much <S%H7235><s%> honey: <S%H1706><s%> so for men to search <S%H2714><s%> their own glory <S%H3519><s%> is not glory. <S%H3519><s%>

He <S%H376><s%> that <S%H834><s%> hath no <S%H369><s%> rule over <S%H4623><s%> his own spirit <S%H7307><s%> is like a city <S%H5892><s%> that is broken down, <S%H6555><s%> and without <S%H369><s%> walls. <S%H2346><s%>
